results.brief_description:

Describes the correct handling and application of the spanner, screwdriver and pliers.

results.title: Hacksaws, shears and vice-clamps
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Engineering”.
Different types of hacksaws and blades are illustrated, and their correct use is demonstrated, common faults being pointed out. Shears, and the making and use of vice-clamps, are also dealt with.

results.title: Measuring and marking
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Engineering”.
Measuring instruments are introduced: the engineer’s rule, micrometers, vernier gauge, outside and inside callipers and odd legs. The marking-off table, the scriber, scribing black, V blocks, finding the centre of a round bar, drawing lines parallel to the edge of the table, the dial test indicator, the surface plate, testing the flatness of a surface by means of a coloured marking agent, spring dividers, and the fitter’s square are also demonstrated.

results.title: Files and filing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Engineering”.
The correct method of use and the difficulties to be overcome in order to fall into the way of making straight, level strokes when filing, whether it be heavy, light or ordinary filing. Different kinds of files are demonstrated including methods of cleaning files, and finally, the importace of practice by the student or trainee is stressed.

results.title: Taps, dies and reamers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Engineering”
The process of drilling and countersinking a hole is demonstrated also the cutting of the thread by means of a set of three taps; lubrication is emphasised, and various kinds of tap wrench are shown. Dies of various kinds, and their uses, are demonstrated, as also are parallel, spiral, tapered, and expanding reamers.

results.title: Micrometer calipers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Engineering”.
The principle of the micrometer is explained in detail, its spindle with a thread of a pitch of 1/40th of an inch, the thimble, the adjustable nut and sleeve, the frame and the anvil, graduated line of the sleeve, graduations on the thimble. Stress is laid on the importance of careful maintenance and cleaning, and regular checks for accuracy of this instrument.

results.title: Methods
results.creator_credit: United States. Navy and De Frenes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic typing”.
Demonstrates the correct posture for typing and proper fingering of the keys; shows the use of the shift key, back spaces, tabulator, carriage return lever, and other parts on both manual and electric machines; also discusses the funtion of various fixtures on the machine. Correct use of single sheets and carbon pack is also demonstrated, together with the use of the paper lever and carriage release lever.
results.description:

results.title: Beaten metalwork, seaming: making a child's mug
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Metalwork”.
This film shows the making of a child’s mug right through from the sheet metal to the finished article and gives an opportunity for a number of craft operations to be observed; the design on paper, transference to metal sheet decoration, stages in forming the body of the mug, by bending, seaming, beating, and planishing. The base and the handle are seen being fashioned and joined to the body by brazing. Finally the cleaning up and polishing are shown.

Metal cutting tools: rake and clearance angles

results.title: Machine operation
results.creator_credit: United States. Navy and De Frenes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic typing”.
Demonstrates correct stroking at speeds ranging from 35 to 180 words per minute. Explains the functions of the various parts of the typewriter and demonstrates the use of these on various types of machines. Demonstrates how to attain correct touch for noiseless, manual, and electric machines.
